Its hard to sound neutral because I am a huge Android fan.  But here is why 
Ipad is still the Gold standard.  Since Apple designs the chip that the OS 
runs off, you can crate a dramatic reduced instruction set.  Its why the 
Ipad can be half the speed, half the cores, half the power, and it will run 
incredibly smooth.  If you look at the latest snapdragon (awesome chip) 
used in several new tablets and arguably the best mobile chip today with 
great specs.  Some of the Android games will actually run slower because 
they were optimized for the Cortex A-9?  Also, the ipad has more optimized 
"large screen" apps.  That being said, there are things I really like with 
the flexibility of android.  I actually really like what Amazon has done to 
its rendition of Android to create a stable uniform experience.  Not a huge 
fan of Toshiba's touch wiz.

I don't think that most people hate apple, they just hate the imbeciles who 
buy their products. I'll give you an example of what I mean. Do you know of 
another phone or tablet on the market other than the iPhone that comes with 
proprietary memory? (meaning that you can't just put in a universal SD card 
to add memory). I sure as hell don't, if there was it didn't last long. But 
Apple gets away with it because most of their consumers don't know a damn 
thing about the thing they're holding in their hand. You want an extra 32gb 
on your iPhone/iPad ?sure only like $120 extra. $120 that you could spend 
on 6, 64gb class 10(good) SD cards which amounts to 384gb.  

You see what I'm getting at? You get so much less than what your paying 
for. Other tablets have HDMI outputs so you can plug your tablet into your 
TV and watch full HD movies/tv/netflix movies. With an iPad you got to buy 
an adapter (of course more money) and even when you get it its not even 
good quality (won't even be full screen) Want to watch a non-youtube video 
on your iPad? Not gona happen unless you buy a $5 internet app. With a 
non-iPad you can carry an extra battery around and always have a backup, 
iPads are a pain in the ass to open and you'll probably need to buy the 
tools needed to open it without causing any damage. 

The shitty thing is they make some cool stuff, I like the exterior and 
operating system on their devices but the hardware is lacking. They could 
let us change SD cards and batteries like every other company, but why 
would they do that when there's a bunch of dumbasses who are willing to 
throw their money at them anyway. 

and I get that there are people who don't care about this stuff and just 
want a phone they like, and I'm not calling those people 
imbeciles/dumbasses, by that I was referring to the individuals who get the 
new iPad/iPhone every year. These are the people who are giving Apple the 
power to overprice without reason.

Well while I do own a couple of Apple products myself, I'm not a big 'fan' 
of the company. For several reasons from patent-trolling to their worker 
condition's in China which seem to be the worst of all tech manufacturers 
there. But the reason I dislike Apple most is its user-base.

There is no other consumer (of any product/brand that I'm aware of) as 
annoying as the Apple fanboy: they are like Jehovah witnesses. Constantly 
needing to shove their 'religion' (Apple is soooooo awesome) in your face. 
In public spaces I sometimes used to check if there were no other Apple 
users around before taking out my pad/pod/phone/book because it's been my 
experience that another 'user' will sometimes just come up to you and start 
some inane conversation about how awesome Apple is. (luckily the tide is 
turning and other brands are now becoming the 'it' brand).

So after having sat through a couple of those awkward encounters, even 
though it may not be directly the companies fault (though they have plenty, 
see above) I kinda get the 'hate'. Sadly in my experience competitor's

Android: functions
Apple: build quality

quality (hardware and software) Hardware is a bit obvious when you look at 
the material they use (example: aluminum body) OK, the HTC one also has a 
superb build quality but it's also one of the only ones. Software-wise is 
when you compare smoothness and hardware between android and iOS. With much 
less power, cores, RAM,... they can make the phone/tablet/.. experience as 
smooth as android devices with much more power.

and optimizations of apple with all the functionalities and power of 
android. Imagine the quality the developers could put into the apps if 
apple would have a device with a snapdragon 800 chip, 3GB of RAM... And

could delete the data of all the users using that service. WD (Western

basis. A simple one time investment and you have up to 4 TB of cloud 
storage. This solution serves more like a network drive. Of course there 
are other companies that have a similar product, but WD first came to mind 
because of a recent ad.

+Ar Row You do know that memory cards are more convenient, right? Instead 
of having to rely on cloud synchronization, which only works as long as you 
have an internet connection, or cables that use USB to a proprietary 
connector, you would have no additional cables to run. Pop a memory card 
into your computer, copy data to it, and then pop it into the device. It 
allows me to separate my apps from my images, music, and videos. Memory 
cards come cheap these days, and weigh next to nothing compared to the 
device you are using it with.

And as far as the watch goes, who cares if I use all the features of it?

By the way, if the SD card fails (which shouldn't happen very often), they 
come at cheap prices.

phone on the market has a toolless removable battery (and you don't void

Apple's phones and tablets have? Precisely not that. Additionally, what 
benefit does one gain from a Rolex that cannot be achieved by a watch that
